meanings.definition: To lie flat on the ground face down, especially in reverence or submission.
meanings.sent1: The monk was prostrating before the sacred statue.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the worshippers were prostrating themselves in prayer.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried prostrating in front of its owner, thinking it would get more treats.
meanings.sent4: The defeated warrior lay prostrating on the battlefield, accepting his loss.
meanings.sent5: The image of the loyal servant prostrating before the king was etched in everyone's memory.

meanings.definition: To cast oneself face down on the ground in humility or adoration.
meanings.sent1: She was prostrating in front of her mentor, seeking forgiveness.
meanings.sent2: The devotees were prostrating before the holy shrine.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy magician ended up prostrating in front of the audience, much to their amusement.
meanings.sent4: The actor prostrating on stage brought a dramatic end to the play.
meanings.sent5: The image of the faithful followers prostrating before their leader was a symbol of unwavering loyalty.
